comment: Dr. Johnson is cool. sociolinguistics was pretty interesting. there's going to be a lot of readings before every class from textbook and/or articles or videos. he's pretty old school and still uses paper for tests. overall, easy a as long as you do the work, recommend
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: TONS of reading! Tests leave u barely any extra time to double-check ur work. No essays and quick assignments. Although this is world-lit, every work has European or Christian influences, super repetitive and boring near the end. 3 exams and if u screw one up basically game over.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Johnson has a clear love for what he does. I will say that this class is representative of the amount of work you put in will show through your grade. You will have to read and understand everything you read, too. It's not a difficult class. Put the work in and you will do good. Don't put the work in and you might want to withdraw.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I'm terrible at linguistics and I would take this class again in a heartbeat. He's a really good teacher.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Hands down my favorite class I've taken. I took him for Grammar before this and loved him then too. He is super organized, grades almost immediately. Decent amount of work but he makes it interesting and is straight forward. I felt like I really learned a lot in this class instead of just working for a grade. Not an easy A but I highly recommend.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: Dr. Johnson was my World Literature professor for the Fall 2022 semester. He was awesome! He creates weekly videos for the learning modules in which he discusses that week's reading assignment, its importance, and what he recommends students take away from the readings. Be prepared to do some reading! He is readily available if you have questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF!!!! STAY AWAY!!!! Was counting down the days until this course was over. TONS of reading to do, LockDown quizzes/tests with webcam, the most random questions appearing, and not enough time to finish! Many ?s requiring an answer in at least TWO paragraphs! PLEASE, DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!! HE SUCKS!!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read

comment: He is a really sweet guy and knows the books he is teaching about! There is only two exams but he does interactive quizzes in his lectures that are only about 5-7mins if that and a short quiz before you begin reading the book. The tests are not hard as long as you read and understand the books. No papers!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Johnson is great! Provides really engaging materials that never felt like busywork, and he really tried to make the class fun and interesting. He even hired voice actors to record lectures in different accents. You have to put in some work but it's nothing unbearable and he tries to make sure you have a really good handle on the material
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Nice enough professor, have nothing bad to say about him. The main issue is that he didn't tell us what pages we were supposed to be reading but expected us to have the chapters read for that week. The tests were fairly hard as they relied majorly on memorization.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: Stars are given for: Effective teaching, Communication outside of class, Study aides, Fair grading, and Interesting. I found active reading and answering learning objectives correlate to better grades on exams and quizzes, and lecturers are quick and to the point with interactive quizzing. Plan on studying for testing.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: He cares about linguistics and his students. That really shows in his lectures and in how open he is to helping his students understand the material. He is very open to talking and assisting in any way he can. The work itself is easy to do, but it can feel like there is a lot to do, so just make sure to stay on top of dates.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Thought the class was harder than it needed to be. You will have to read everything assigned and study a lot for the tests and quizzes. Graded harshly during the semester but loosened up a little near the end. Took the class online and listened to pre-recorded lectures, he knows a lot about the material and I found it very helpful for the tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Not a ridiculous amount of homework. Grades the short answer portion of quizzes pretty harshly. Most of the quiz questions are in the lecture. Uses lockdown browser and camera so beware of that. Overall, pretty straight choice for a prof.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Johnson is a very good professor. His online class wasn't overwhelming especially during the pandemic. You have weekly assignments that rotate between quizzes, discussion posts, and essays. There were 6 essays but only around 400 words and he always gives feedback. There was also only 2 test. I would easily take him again if I could.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Caring--Tough grader

comment: Essays were graded harshly, bought the textbook but it was only needed for one quiz.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: I have a 4.0 GPA, and this class was the struggle. Maybe it just wasn't for me. Idk. Professor Johnson cares about his students and has a passion for language. That said, you will largely be teaching yourself from the textbook, and quizzes & tests (proctored) cover ALOT of info, which, imo, didn't stand out in the reading. Studied HOURS to pass.

I took him for an online class and had several technological difficulties but he was easy to work with. Each week we had an assigned reading but I watched videos and read sparknotes and got 100's on his quizzes. There's also several discussion posts but they're fairly simple and you don't need to respond to others. No essays.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Johnson is super caring and helpful. He gives clear feedback as well. Quizzes can be difficult, so be prepared for those. Also, Shmoop saved my life in this class! Super helpful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Both textbooks were used! There were reading quizzes with each section/chapter. There were 4 essays last semester and each had a 4-8 pg requirement.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He makes learning really fun and enjoyable. Made a lot of funny jokes throughout the course. Reading quizzes aren't difficult at all. Solid professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Lots of quizzes and homework assignments, but they take very little time. All of the information he is looking for can be found in his lectures. He explains everything very clearly. No confusion! Follow the syllabus and pay attention to the lectures and you will do well. Only one book required; homework assignments come from the book.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Really nice professor, but he gives a lot of work and grades very harshly. You have to study really hard for the tests, but the course content is super interesting and he presents it well. He also throws in really interesting and relevant links and videos with each module.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Johnson is pretty tough as in you do have to read and study to get good grades on his quizzes and tests. Nothing too crazy though, and his class is worth the work. He is one of my favorite professors because he is intelligent, fair and funny.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: The material on the quizzes seem to come out of nowhere. I do the readings, I listen to the lectures, and finish any other assignments required but apparently miss large parts that appear on the quiz. Also, the lectures and the readings contradict one another. This class has felt like a waste of time. I'd recommend another professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: Great Professor I would take this course again in a heart beat the quizzes aren't difficult at all, as well as the Hw and the post discussions. As long as you put a conscious effort you will be fine. Mr. Johnson gives great feedback and I can actually say I have learned so much in taking this course. Do yourself a favor and take the course!!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Johnson was very nice and funny and I liked coming to class and hearing the lectures. The material is very interesting. You HAVE  to read carefully. The pop quizzes are sometimes on the most random things. Make sure you READ READ READ and take good notes. The quiz questions usually show up again on the test. Not the easiest class, but still fun.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Johnson is tough. He gives quizzes at the beginning of every class which I feel is unfair because you must read to memorize, not to retain. Midterm is very tough, do not wait to study for it like I did.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: I LOVED this class! Dr. Johnson actually makes a research paper interesting and easy to write. The course work was interesting and cohesive. He is accessible and easy to work with. I enjoyed taking his class and I'm so glad that it wasn't as boring or mundane as most English 1102 seems to be. Would definitely take him again.

Is this guy for real? No context or guidance on what to ACTUALLY study. Midterm was literally based on ANYTHING from the 70+ pages of reading, ANYTHING discussed in class, or covered in the reading quizzes (quizzes you either fail or make a 75% on if you answer 1 question wrong). No study guide, no review reflective of the actual exam. No fair.

AWESOME prof. If the homework doesn't seem perfectly clear, go with your gut. He doesn't take off a lot of points for doing it in a different way as long as you show effort and understanding. Lectures may seem a little long and monotonous, but it's good to pay attention for those quizzes and tests! Totally worth.

I took his Online class and the setup for the course was very clear and super organized. Each "learning module" is due before 9am on Mondays and Thursdays and the readings from "Language" book were super interesting and I enjoyed looking forward to reading them. The papers  were hard to start and understand what was required but great class overall

I took the online course. Tests are timed.  Be sure to use a reliable computer.  Mine froze during a couple of quizzes.  By the time I could restart computer, my time was up.  Quizzes are due before the lecture.  That sucks because if you don't understand text you read you're SOL.  Great communicator, accessible, but this is not an easy A.

I wouldn't call this an easy class, but I still loved it. He sets up a very accessible course with various real-world examples to help you understand the material. There is a lot of reading involved, but that's to be expected from an online course. Read and do the work, and you should be fine.

I'm not a fan of linguistics but was looking forward to taking Dr. Johnson after reading his reviews. However, I HATED how we had to take a quiz before our learning module opened. I think that is unfair even after I've already read that material that was going to be on that quiz. He is also a very tough grader, but very nice and helpful.

Dr Johnson was helpful.  I liked him but linguistics is not my forte. I took class online and was not happy when I found out before the final I could have used books for tests and quizzes. The phonetics on the mid-term killed me.  Homework counts as being present in class.

I love linguistics (doing a minor) and I'm glad Dr. Johnson really expected us to learn the content in depth. He was a surprisingly detailed grader though. A pretty challenging midterm and final, lots of weekly, graded homework assignments, and a final short paper. He sort of ignores you sometimes and is sarcastic, but overall a good professor.

This is my 2nd time taking Dr. Johnson. He is great. He is understanding about personal stuff and helpful in and out of class. His grading is fair and usually conveys exactly what he wants. He does give a lot of quizzes, but doesn't require any essays other than exams. Exams can be difficult if you do not go to class. He does take attendance!

Dr. Johnson is one of the most professional professors I've ever had.  He has a sense of humor, and he will share some jokes at the beginning of class which pertain to language and linguistics.  Dr. Johnson is fair, intelligent, knowledgeable, up front, he engages the class in interesting discussions, will quiz, and he is organized. Recommended.

Great teacher.  Very understanding if you had to be out.  Grades very fair.  Assignments not too hard, but there is a lot of work and reading.  I would take him again.  One of my favorite teachers ever.

Class is relatively easy; there is a lot of writing, so be prepared. I think on the surface Dr. Johnson appears somewhat nice, but when communicating with him on a one on one basis, I found him to be cold and distant.  I would not take him again.  At times I felt extremely uncomfortable around him, and he seemed to have 'favorite' students.

Dr. Johnson was a great teacher! He was interesting, funny, and taught the material very well. I was already interested in Linguistics, and he was just one of those teachers that makes you take an interest and turn it into a passion. I would definitely recommend him and would take him again!

The class I had is no longer a requirement. I am sure that Johnson will continue to be a good prof however. He engages the class with fun competitions and is easy on the attendance. He is a good prof by me.
he's the best.
He's the MAN. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
Professor David is one of the best English professor here in KSU.

Dr. Johnson is awesome.  He is one of my favorite professors EVER.  Fair grading, great lessons, great lectures (never boring, believe it or not).  Kids who can't get into his class have even been known to cry.  I would have.  Good luck getting in, people!

He is awesome!! I mean it!! He is such a great teacher that you actually enjoy doing the work for him. He is very clear in his material, patient with your questions, and very approachable. He makes jokes in class and teaches at the same time. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
